1578341356_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
After giving a mute to barnstokkr and duck0  for their OT spam, here is my view on the matter.

Personally, I always thought it was dumb that so many people would upload regular porn to a dark network when so much is available on the clearnet. I get that porn is banned in some areas like the Middle East, but there are plenty of special purpose sites on zeronet that are dedicated to specifically that. It doesn't need to be shared everywhere nor does the zeronet community need to be tolerant of it. A user having a right to exercise speech does not mean that user has a right to infringe on the speech of the site owner they are publishing to.

In the end, KopyKate is qkitty's site so it is pretty much her rules of the playing field. If the user doesn't like it, the are free to  clone the site like the guy who posts Hollywood flicks to [KopyKate2](/15GACn5cumjT2RsN7NjfnUYuM2a96xN5aD) does. I believe he said he is tolerant of everything on his site, so they are free to publish porn there.

To be fair, these inconsiderate ass hats should be thanking her for giving the community a site that can be cloned in the first place. She could have released it and kept the code encrypted. I suspect those who want to protect their freedom to post whatever they want go on to refuse to start their own sites because nobody wants to hear the garbage that they have to say. But that's just my opinion. Last I checked, TrollTalk.bit has yet to be created.

> [hferbwauif](#comment_56_16dnrZKRMLhQCjv6nxx7tP5KJ2H2PdqRxP): If the owner kept the code for the site encrypted, the site wouldn't work. 

I used the wrong term sorry, I meant to use 'obfuscated', so you're technically correct.

> [hferbwauif](#comment_56_16dnrZKRMLhQCjv6nxx7tP5KJ2H2PdqRxP): I'll point out this is the kind of people who is encouraging censorship on a decentralized platform.

I have to disagree, if I develop a platform, it is my choice to release the code obfuscated (which distracts from alterations) or developed with multiple comments in the hopes of assisting alterations. I do hope you realise that there are aspects of zeronet that are just as obfuscated such as the spam filter used by some board owners & ZeroID

> [filips](#comment_406_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Your code can't be truly encrypted, because otherwise it won't run unless it is decrypted at some point,

Yes, I know, I used the wrong word, hence my switch to the term 'obfuscated'.

I would say ban all porn, but I'm pretty sure that would include that official music video of enish - fiks which is practically impossible to find anymore. I got it from a bandcamp purchase of his digital album many years ago.

> [caropc1v6](#comment_11_14mqeC9JkKTrWmaR1X4LdtdAuB8qaAhbNB): You're worried about the trash of the state, in something that fights ANY censorship,

The choice to avoid sex & porn and to keep it off of some sites such as ZeroTalk is not censorship, it's called maintaining the direction of the site owner. Ergo the title, "__I__ personally would ban all porn if __I__ had a file-sharing or video site"

> [styromaniac](#comment_1668_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): You say I'm pro censorship. ...

Why even respond to people like that when there is a clear indication that there is no reason or agreement to be negotiated on. It is clear that the user 'caropc1v6' said that porn is allowed on the KopyKate2 clone so it is not as if that material is forsaken. But for some reason they refuse to understand that a site owner deciding to permit or ban what is published on their owned site is somehow interpreted as a infringement of their right to disagree with the views of the site owner. Hence the persistent and repeated "I don't care if it is YOUR site, it is still censorship!" argument.

If barnstokkr gave as many shits as they claim to they would clone these sites as a direct competitor to the supposedly 'projecting censorship' ones.

1578551830_1Drej4kKBea1TryGPYfVZgzDxaB71.body: If you let her stay with you for over five months without contributing, you are establishing your boundaries and expectations of the relationship. Why would she ever change when you have already accepted her for who she is now?

> [fib](#comment_70_1Drej4kKBea1TryGPYfVZgzDxaB71rsKkK): said she hasn't helped with the bills because she isn't comfortable, 

But yet comfortable enough to live with you and have you cook for her? If I was worried about someone mishandling my money, they would likely mishandle my food as well. Odd excuse.

> [fib](#comment_70_1Drej4kKBea1TryGPYfVZgzDxaB71rsKkK): and said I must ask her if I want something from her because she will not know nor will she think of ways to help

Yes... having a responsibility of paying your own bills, cleaning up your own house, doing your own chores, managing your own pets, is a hard life for any adult. No wonder there are so many of them who haven't learn the basic expectations of independent living and have found clever ways for others to do these tasks for them.

From what I understand of the situation is she likely lived with someone who took care of her the same way you are now because that is her life and her expectations of what is to be contributed to her relationships. This is not all on her though as you have accepted her in these conditions.

It reminds me of an old saying that I often tell myself. "We humans are free to gladly serve (and attempt to help) others in our own heavens, or happily forcefully rule over others in our own hell. But your happiness is what you make of it."

> [fib](#comment_74_1Drej4kKBea1TryGPYfVZgzDxaB71rsKkK): I'm going to miss that woman, even if she is a pain in the ass.

You're going to have to keep loving yourself before you are able to find someone who loves you for you rather than what you can give or do for them.

1579301889_1A8k2FFyono2dUQWKaRzsRvbXguVu.body:
The problem with public proxies is that while the ones that are ran off of cheap server hardware is enough to handle a private portal or maybe 5 concurrent users, but any more and the client will begin to slow as seen with 0net.io proxy. Of course the remedy to this is more expensive server space, but expect to foot that cost yourself as nobody is willing to donate to zeronet public proxy admins and implementing a miner gate to cover some visitor usage is frowned upon. (Because most clear net users expect free or want to use their personal details as a form of browsing compensation.)

I pay $5 a month for my server space which is enough to provide a private portal plus space to seed documentaries, but that's about it. It would crash & burn if it was opened up for public usage.

1579306799_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
I would say it would be more hassle than it is worth. While the settings file can be loaded as client specific, if the clients are sharing the same /data/ location, it means each client is going to also share the same users, sites, and cert, json files which will mean a syncing nightmare.

I'm not a developer of zeronet but I'm pretty sure it was not meant to be ran in such a fashion. It would be more beneficial to just have smaller independent zeronet clients that serve special purposes. Like a node just for social media, and another just for seeding larger files, etc.

1579445364_17KQehVm2u5r4GAjqkC3jRcxepzK6.body:
Much like on The Pirate Bay, there is no way to help those who release media but then decide not to seed it for others who may show interest. Everyone wants to be a hit & run and that causes unseeded content. If you want to find some working titles, check out the documentaries uploaded by [htgozn](/big.kopykate.bit/?Channel=htgozn@zeroid.bit), [htgozn2](/big.kopykate.bit/?Channel=htgozn2@zeroid.bit), and [htgozn Workout Music](/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:channel+id:15f3_1J58Rie679DVSuKB1iDyFFTbzmaMaY2bt2) as the material is well seeded.

Some people use Zeronet as a means to protect their communication, while others come to this network strictly looking for free shit.

> [blahblah69](#comment_24_1ErPX9yuZjokdcxUGavdRYRhwynA4j8d6q): i mean with laws constantly changing one could be charged and prosecuted for dam near anything these days, from hate speech to copyrighted or illegal content. [...] However its a tricky process to balance freedom of speech or expression against what governments and law enforcement consider appropriate.

Emphasis on this as you can be imprisoned for the most minor of reasons. So we can either choose to Live for something, or Die for nothing.

> [progi](#comment_14_17KQehVm2u5r4GAjqkC3jRcxepzK6ri51W): on The Pirate Bay or torrenting have no problems.

Sharing files on Zeronet is not torrenting, it should not be compared as such. I mentioned TPB because we were discussing seeding. No media will ever be distributed if people are not willing to keep their PCs online and zeronet client running to share the media to other people when there is a lack of a central server. Any decentralised technology will face this obstacle and the easiest way to fix it is with popularity.

A bit of a dilemma when Zeronet provides a space for activity without judgement in a world where the mainstream News outlets are controlled by a handful of billion dollar and euro companies.
Also a main problem is people forget to ['PIN'](/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/?Files) their smaller files so that their client doesn't auto remove them over time.

[1580066784-Louis Rossmann and Right to Repair.mp4](/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1580066784_1Fza2SFyqmiLLUc99fACNkDNPQ7k4V3935) Size: 32.43 MB Uploaded: 3.4 GB
•••••

Of course the solution to this is to just make another account and discard the old user ID which will also  ensure upload permanency as the original uploader couldn't remove the files even if they wanted to or were forced to. 

But yeah, disaster for orphaned files.

1580901933_1A8k2FFyono2dUQWKaRzsRvbXguVu.body:
> [aassddff](#comment_26_1A8k2FFyono2dUQWKaRzsRvbXguVuXQHYS): Hopefully people will be able to see it somehow.

Some advice when uploading to KopyKate.

 - Keep your files seeded with an always online client. It's your stuff, don't expect others to seed it for you. And even if they are interested, if there are no seeds online to upload it to them at that moment, they will chalk the user as another failed uploader which will result in more unseeded content.

 - After publishing the file, don't forget to go to your [FILES](/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/?Files) tab on ZeroHello and tick the uploaded file and PIN it to ensure the file's persistence so that your client will not auto remove it over time.

 - A very large percentage of users who visit KopyKate do so with their mobile device. Storage space and bandwidth matter for these small devices and they are often used by people who live in not so developed areas and likely suffer from slower bandwidth speeds. Be considerate about this. The smaller you can make the file while preserving decent quality the better. You'll save local space, viewers will save their space, and your file will be more easily to distribute. Re-encoding a file is a pain, but it's worth it as nobody is coming to Zeronet to find 4k video.

 - Provide good thumbnails, descriptive title for ease of search, and short description. This will attract viewer interests and maybe even someone who's is willing & has space to seed your files with you.

 - Make your uploads count. Each user on KopyKate has a hard coded upload limit due to a size limitation of their users.json and data.json files on the site. Once this limit has been reached you won't be able to sign the file anymore meaning no more deletes, edits, or uploads under that username.

Hope that helps

> [aassddff](#comment_23_1A8k2FFyono2dUQWKaRzsRvbXguVuXQHYS): Now two people have told me they can't see newer videos either.

One of Zeronet's flaws is it has sync problems in that. An update is pushed, site updates. (second later) someone else uploads a video (publishes an update) and even though their change did propagate the network, the previous update was still being processed by that node and the latest update was never processed on that node.

A remedy is to preform a manual Update / Check files which will update the files for that peer / user and populate their videos with the rest.

1580925973_1CcmrTeqtuoQtUpuxBZ9wFZz1tPaB.body:
As moor stated, you can create a dedicated music channel on IFS to share music.

A word of advice, use something like [mp3tag](www.mp3tag.de/en) to help normalize filenames  of any ! and & characters as it will cause the file to error out and fail to be seeded. (there are likely more invalid characters that are allowed, but those two are the most common.

Oh, don't forget to PIN any files that you share. Small files are not auto-pinned by default and your client will end up auto-deleting them after some time / seed count / ratio trigger.

They are found under the IFS Cluster you selected.

1581330554_19WWfebCWifDRTKiapRbErUjEpDDY.body:
There is a command line parameter that can be used to open a specific browser on Zeronet launch

--open_browser [NAME] 	Open homepage in web browser automatically 	

This way zeronet will launch the browser of your choice while leaving your default set browser unchanged.

I've been attempting to discuss matters of Zeronet on the clearnet for the past four years. It should give a hint as to the current levels of information suppression an a variety of other subjects.. 

> .Once they saw the link 127.0.0.1 they considered it to be a torjan.

The local address is the true magic of zeronet as those who attempt to prevent the spread of information become a peer when viewing the network, just as the custodians of copyright can't reference material on zeronet without appearing that they themselves are making said content available. 

This is all without mentioning the redundancy aspects of the network and the parties desire to remove or censor otherwise permanent information.
